text: Anyang () is a city in Gyeonggi Province, South Korea. With a population about of 600,000 People, it is the 20th largest city in South Korea. It is a satellite city of Seoul and located about to south of Seoul, and to north of Suwon. It is connected to Seoul via the Seoul Subway Line 1 and Line 4. == Development == The city has developed along the Anyang Stream, which is 32.2 km long. The city is divided into two halves; the Manan district and Dongan districts. The Dongan district has about 356,566 people and the Manan district has about 216,714 people. Anyang is famous for Anyang yuwonji and the Anyang art park. It has seven mountains. Mt. Suri is the most famous one. == References == Category:Cities in South Korea
title: Anyang, Gyeonggi
